com.camerontec.catalys.server.ha.collections.distributed

Class DistributedByteArrayStore

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.camerontec.catalys.server.ha.collections.distributed.DistributedByteArrayStore
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IReplicable, ILockable, IDistributedCollectionMessageListener, IByteArrayStore, IVersionedSizedStore, IJournalingStoreAccessor, Closeable, AutoCloseable

    public final class DistributedByteArrayStore
extends Object
implements IReplicable, IByteArrayStore, ILockable, IDistributedCollectionMessageListener, IJournalingStoreAccessor
    Store implementation which wraps a IPersistentByteArrayStore for the purpose of replicating all IByteArrayStore.WriteRequests to other nodes in the cluster.

    This implementation performs both the master and slave distributed store roles on behalf of its underlying {code IPersistentByteArrayStore}. The general handling of external requests is as follows:

    • Write requests received via IByteArrayStore.write(com.camerontec.util.collection.IByteArrayStore.WriteRequest) are assumed to only occur on the master and thus are replicated to other nodes as well as being delegated to the underlying persistent store
    • Read, version and size requests (IByteArrayStore.read(com.camerontec.util.collection.IByteArrayStore.ReadRequest, com.camerontec.util.data.BytesSegment), IVersionedSizedStore.version(com.camerontec.util.data.BytesSegment), IVersionedSizedStore.size() are simply delegated to the underlying persistent store
    • Requests received via IDistributedCollectionMessageListener are all assumed to be in slave context and serviced accordingly

    In addition, this implementation acts as a locking proxy for underlying store access via the IJournalingStoreAccessor interface which is expected to be used only during synchronization of the underlying persistent store with other nodes in the cluster.

    This class provides guaranteed thread safety for the underlying persistent store when accessed by user threads. That is, all accesses via the IByteArrayStore interface are serialized.

    The internal data synchronization mechanism, however, requires that the underlying persistent store be locked for many operations at a time which is why the lock and unlock() methods are exposed. It is the responsibility of the internal data synchronization thread(s) to use these locking primitives correctly and therefore accesses to the underlying persistent store via the IJournalingStoreAccessor interface are not serialized.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DistributedByteArrayStore

        public DistributedByteArrayStore(String name,
                                 Properties properties,
                                 IPersistentByteArrayStore persistentStore,
                                 IJournalingStoreAccessor journalAccessor,
                                 IReplicator replicator,
                                 IDistributedCollectionSynchronizationListener synchronizationListener,
                                 byte dataVID)
                          throws IOException
        Constructor.
        Parameters:
        name - the store's name
        properties - The store properties.
        persistentStore - The persistent store being distributed.
        journalAccessor - The journal accessor to provide a view of the underlying journal required for data synchronization.
        replicator - The replicator to be used for distribution of updates.
        synchronizationListener - The listener to be used for publishing synchronization lost events.
        dataVID - The data version ID used on this node when updating my version. Relevant only when servicing IByteArrayStore.write(com.camerontec.util.collection.IByteArrayStore.WriteRequest) requests (which only occur in master context).
        Throws:
        IOException - On error when interacting with the backing store.

      • lock

        public void lock()
        Description copied from interface: ILockable
        Locks the collection, blocking until the lock can be acquired.

        The caller must ILockable.unlock() the collection after use to prevent other threads from blocking indefinitely.

        Specified by:
        lock in interface ILockable

      • tryLock

        public boolean tryLock()
        Description copied from interface: ILockable
        Try to lock the collection, returning immediately regardless of whether or not the lock was acquired.

        The caller must ILockable.unlock() the collection after use to prevent other threads from blocking indefinitely.

        The caller must also take care not to call ILockable.unlock() unless the lock was successfully acquired as this could corrupt the lock count associated with the calling thread.

        Specified by:
        tryLock in interface ILockable
        Returns:
        True if the lock was acquired, false otherwise.

      • unlock

        public void unlock()
        Description copied from interface: ILockable

        Specified by:

      • isLockHeldByCurrentThread

        Returns:

      • lockHistory

        public void lockHistory()
        Description copied from interface: ILockable
        Locks the collection's history, blocking until the lock can be acquired.

        Locking the collection's history does *not* lock access to the store, it only prevents operations that change the *history* of the store (compaction).

        The caller must call ILockable.unlockHistory() on the collection after use to prevent other threads from blocking indefinitely.

        Specified by:
        lockHistory in interface ILockable

      • tryLockHistory

        public boolean tryLockHistory()
        Description copied from interface: ILockable
        Try to lock the collection's history, returning immediately regardless of whether or not the lock was acquired.

        Locking the collection's history does *not* lock access to the store, it only prevents operations that change the *history* of the store (compaction).

        The caller must call ILockable.unlockHistory() on the collection after use to prevent other threads from blocking indefinitely.

        The caller must also take care not to call ILockable.unlockHistory() unless the lock was successfully acquired as this could corrupt the lock count associated with the calling thread.

        Specified by:
        tryLockHistory in interface ILockable
        Returns:
        True if the lock was acquired, false otherwise.

      • findVersionInHistory

        public boolean findVersionInHistory(BytesSegment version,
                                    BytesSegment versionInHistory,
                                    IVersionComparator comparator)
                             throws VersionComparisonException
        Description copied from interface: IJournalingStoreAccessor
        Searches for a write request in the journal's history with the given version.
        Specified by:
        findVersionInHistory in interface IJournalingStoreAccessor
        Parameters:
        version - a version to search for
        versionInHistory - if the searched version is found in history, this BytesSegment, if not null, will wrap the local version's bytes. If the searched version is not found in history, or if this BytesSegment is null, it is ignored.
        comparator - comparator to use in search
        Returns:
        true iff. this journal contains a write request with the given version
        Throws:
        VersionComparisonException - if comparator is unable to compare these versions

      • iterate

        public void iterate(IByteArrayStore.WriteRequest writeRequest,
                    IJournalingStoreAccessor.IWriteRequestHandler handler)
        Description copied from interface: IJournalingStoreAccessor
        Iterates over the indices/keys and values in the store, using the given write request as the destination of the iteration. The order of the iteration is implementation dependent, i.e. it does not necessarily follow the order of the journal. Callers should not expect this method to populate the destination write request's version when iterating. Callers can expect this method to populate the destination write request's type with IByteArrayStore.WriteRequest.Type.SET when iterating.
        Specified by:
        iterate in interface IJournalingStoreAccessor
        Parameters:
        writeRequest - the destination write request used during the iteration
        handler - the iteration handler

                               VersionComparisonException
        Description copied from interface: IJournalingStoreAccessor

      • writeRequestsBetween

        public void writeRequestsBetween(BytesSegment version1,
                                 BytesSegment version2,
                                 IVersionComparator comparator,
                                 IByteArrayStore.WriteRequest writeRequest,
                                 IJournalingStoreAccessor.IWriteRequestHandler handler)
                          throws IllegalArgumentException,
                                 VersionComparisonException
        Description copied from interface: IJournalingStoreAccessor
        Iterates over the write requests contained in the journal that are located after (and excluding) the write requests with the lowest version and before (and including) the write request with the highest version. This method is not sensitive to the relative ordering of the given versions, i.e. they may be passed in any order.
        Specified by:
        writeRequestsBetween in interface IJournalingStoreAccessor
        Parameters:
        version1 - a write request's version
        version2 - a write request's version
        comparator - comparator to use in search
        writeRequest - the destination write request used during the iteration
        handler - the iteration handler
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the journal does not contain write requests with the given versions
        VersionComparisonException - if comparator is unable to compare these versions

      • read

        public int read(IByteArrayStore.ReadRequest readRequest,
                BytesSegment value,
                boolean randomAccess)
        Description copied from interface: IByteArrayStore
        Submit a read request to the store. This is a lower-level variant of IByteArrayStore.read(ReadRequest, BytesSegment) allowing clients to specify whether this request is performed as a random-access operation or is part of a traversal of the collection, in which case the store implementation may be able to perform some optimizations (like caching I/O operations for example).
        Specified by:
        read in interface IByteArrayStore
        Parameters:
        readRequest - The read request.
        value - the bytes segment to read into.
        randomAccess - true if this is a random-access read, false if this is a traversal read.
        Returns:
        The value length in bytes.

      • keys

        public void keys(IByteArrayStore.IKeyHandler handler)
        Description copied from interface: IByteArrayStore
        Iterates through the keys in the store.
        Specified by:
        keys in interface IByteArrayStore
        Parameters:
        handler - iteration handler. Method IByteArrayStore.IKeyHandler.key(BytesSegment) in this handler is called in turn for each key in the store. The iteration can be stopped at any time by having method IByteArrayStore.IKeyHandler.key(BytesSegment) return false.

      • onWriteRequest

        public boolean onWriteRequest(WriteRequestMessage writeRequest)
        Description copied from interface: IDistributedCollectionMessageListener
        On receipt of a write request from a peer distributed collection.

        It is the implementation's responsibility to respond with an acknowledgment. Normally this is a point to point MessageType.AUTO_ACK_MESSAGE.

        Specified by:
        onWriteRequest in interface IDistributedCollectionMessageListener
        Parameters:
        writeRequest - The write request.
        Returns:
        true if the write was successfully applied

      • onReplayRequest

        public void onReplayRequest(ReplayRequestMessage replayRequest)
        Description copied from interface: IDistributedCollectionMessageListener
        On receipt of a request from a peer distributed collection to replay write requests for the purpose of data synchronization.

        It is the implementation's responsibility to respond with at least one ReplayResponseMessage even if there is no data to send.

        Specified by:
        onReplayRequest in interface IDistributedCollectionMessageListener
        Parameters:
        replayRequest - The replay request.
